title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 19 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 19.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19:2, why are the children of Israel commanded to be holy?
options: Because the LORD their God is holy
Because they will inherit the land
Because they are chosen for battle
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD their God is holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:2 states that the children of Israel shall be holy because the LORD their God is holy.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 19:3 say each man shall fear?
questions.correctAnswer: His mother and his father
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:3 commands that every man shall fear his mother and his father and keep the sabbaths.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19:4, what are the Israelites instructed not to turn unto or make for themselves?
questions.correctAnswer: Idols and molten gods
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:4 instructs the Israelites not to turn unto idols nor make molten gods for themselves.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19:6, by when must a peace offering be eaten?
options: The same day and the next day
questions.correctAnswer: The same day and the next day
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:6 states the peace offering shall be eaten the same day it is offered and on the morrow.

questions.question: What must happen if any of the peace offering remains until the third day according to Leviticus 19:6?
options: It shall be burnt in the fire
It shall be given to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be burnt in the fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:6 says that if any remains until the third day, it must be burnt in the fire.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 19:7 states that eating a peace offering on the third day is acceptable.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:7 declares that eating the peace offering on the third day is abominable and shall not be accepted.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19:9, what must not be wholly reaped from the corners of the field?
questions.correctAnswer: The harvest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:9 commands not to wholly reap the corners of the field when harvesting.

questions.question: Who are the leftover grapes and gleanings to be left for according to Leviticus 19:10?
questions.correctAnswer: The poor and the stranger
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:10 instructs leaving the gleanings and remaining grapes for the poor and stranger.

questions.question: Leviticus 19:11 says you shall not do which of the following?
questions.correctAnswer: Steal, deal falsely, or lie
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:11 commands not to steal, deal falsely, or lie one to another.

questions.question: What shall you not do according to Leviticus 19:16?
options: Go up and down as a talebearer among thy people
questions.correctAnswer: Go up and down as a talebearer among thy people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:16 forbids going about as a talebearer or standing against the blood of your neighbor.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 19:18 commands to love your neighbor as yourself.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:18 commands not to avenge or bear grudges but to love your neighbor as yourself.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19:19, which of the following is forbidden?
options: Letting cattle gender with a diverse kind
questions.correctAnswer: Letting cattle gender with a diverse kind
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:19 forbids cattle breeding with diverse kinds, sowing mingled seed, and wearing mixed fabrics.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Leviticus 19:30: 'Ye shall keep my ______, and reverence my sanctuary.'
questions.correctAnswer: sabbaths
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:30 instructs to keep the sabbaths and reverence the sanctuary.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 19:32 say you shall do before the hoary head?
options: Rise up and honour the face of the old man
questions.correctAnswer: Rise up and honour the face of the old man
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:32 commands rising up before the hoary head and honoring the old man.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 19:35 commands to use dishonest weights and measures in judgment.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:35 commands not to do unrighteousness in judgment and to use just balances and weights.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 19 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 19 teach us about holiness in our daily lives?
options: We should strive to be holy because God is holy
We can be holy through our own strength alone
Holiness is only for priests and not for all believers
Holiness means avoiding all contact with others
questions.correctAnswer: We should strive to be holy because God is holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:2 commands the children of Israel to be holy because the LORD their God is holy. This teaches believers the importance of pursuing holiness by reflecting God's character in their daily lives (verses 2, 30, 37).

questions.question: A believer struggles with anger toward a brother who sinned against them. Based on Leviticus 19, what biblical truth would you share?
options: You should hate your brother in your heart
Do not hate your brother but rebuke him and do not let sin remain
Ignore the sin and avoid confrontation
Seek revenge to teach him a lesson
questions.correctAnswer: Do not hate your brother but rebuke him and do not let sin remain
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:17 instructs not to hate a brother in the heart, but to rebuke him to prevent sin from persisting. This highlights the importance of loving correction and reconciliation (verses 16-18).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 19 teach about honesty and integrity in business and daily dealings?
options: You shall not steal, deal falsely, or lie to one another
It is acceptable to cheat if no one finds out
You may withhold wages overnight with your workers
Honesty is only required in religious matters
questions.correctAnswer: You shall not steal, deal falsely, or lie to one another
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:11-13 commands honesty in dealings, forbidding theft, falsehood, and withholding wages overnight. This teaches the biblical virtue of integrity in all aspects of life (verses 11, 13, 15, 35-36).

questions.question: How does Leviticus 19 instruct believers to treat strangers living among them?
options: Love the stranger as yourself because you were strangers in Egypt
Ignore strangers and keep to yourselves
Treat strangers harshly to protect your land
Allow strangers to live only if they follow all your customs
questions.correctAnswer: Love the stranger as yourself because you were strangers in Egypt
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:33-34 teaches kindness and love toward strangers, reminding believers that they were once strangers in Egypt. This encourages hospitality and compassion (verses 18, 33-34).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19, how should we approach judgment and fairness?
options: Judge without partiality, respecting neither poor nor mighty
Favor the rich in judgment to gain favor
Ignore justice if it causes conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Judge without partiality, respecting neither poor nor mighty
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:15 commands impartiality in judgment, not showing respect to persons but judging neighbors righteously. This teaches fairness and justice as God desires (verses 15, 35-36).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 19 say about love for neighbors?
options: Love your neighbor as yourself and do not bear a grudge
Love only those who love you back
questions.correctAnswer: Love your neighbor as yourself and do not bear a grudge
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:18 highlights the command to love neighbors as oneself and forbids vengeance or holding grudges. This foundational teaching calls for forgiveness and reconciliation (verses 17-18).

questions.question: How does Leviticus 19 instruct believers regarding the Sabbath and reverence for God’s sanctuary?
options: Keep the sabbaths and reverence the sanctuary
Only priests should keep the sabbath
Sabbath is a day for business and trade
questions.correctAnswer: Keep the sabbaths and reverence the sanctuary
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:3 and 30 instruct to keep the sabbaths and reverence the sanctuary, emphasizing obedience and respect for God’s holy times and places (verses 3, 30).

questions.question: What guidance does Leviticus 19 provide regarding personal appearance and mourning customs?
options: Do not round the corners of your heads or mar the corners of your beard
Make cuttings in your flesh to show mourning
Follow the customs of surrounding nations
questions.correctAnswer: Do not round the corners of your heads or mar the corners of your beard
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:27-28 forbids cutting the hair at the corners of the head or beard and making marks in the flesh for the dead, teaching separation from pagan mourning practices (verses 27-28).

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 19 teaches that one should not use enchantments or observe times for divination.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:26 and 31 warn against using enchantments and seeking wizards or familiar spirits, instructing believers to avoid defilement by such practices (verses 26, 31).

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 19 permits making molten gods and idols for worship.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:4 forbids turning to idols or making molten gods, emphasizing exclusive worship of the LORD God (verses 4, 2).

questions.question: When offering a peace offering, how many days does Leviticus 19 allow the meat to be eaten before it must be burned?
options: Two days only; any remaining by the third day must be burned
Three days; it can be eaten any time within that period
Only the day of the offering
questions.correctAnswer: Two days only; any remaining by the third day must be burned
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:6-8 explains that peace offerings should be eaten on the day of the offering and the next day; if any remains by the third day, it is abominable and must be burned (verses 6-8).

questions.question: A farmer is harvesting crops. According to Leviticus 19, what should he do regarding the corners of his field and grape harvest?
options: Do not reap the corners or gather gleanings; leave them for the poor and strangers
Harvest every part thoroughly to avoid waste
Only leave the corners for animals to eat
Sell all parts of the harvest to the highest bidder
questions.correctAnswer: Do not reap the corners or gather gleanings; leave them for the poor and strangers
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:9-10 instructs not to reap the corners of the field or gleanings of the harvest and vineyard, leaving them for the poor and stranger, teaching generosity and care for others (verses 9-10).

questions.question: How does Leviticus 19 instruct believers regarding respect for the elderly?
options: Rise up before the hoary head and honor the old man
Ignore older people to focus on youth
Only honor those who are wealthy
Respect is earned only through achievements
questions.correctAnswer: Rise up before the hoary head and honor the old man
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:32 commands rising before the elderly and honoring them, linking this respect to the fear of God (verses 32, 30).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Leviticus 19 teaches that you shall not ______ your neighbor, nor stand against the blood of your neighbor.
options: go up and down as a talebearer
questions.correctAnswer: go up and down as a talebearer
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:16 warns against going about as a talebearer among the people and standing against the blood of a neighbor, emphasizing the importance of protecting others from harm and gossip (verses 16-18).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 19 say about mixing different kinds in your livestock, seed, or clothing?
options: Do not let your cattle gender with diverse kinds, do not sow mingled seed, and do not wear garments of mixed linen and wool
Mixing is encouraged to increase variety
Only clothing mixing is forbidden, not livestock or seed
These regulations apply only to priests
questions.correctAnswer: Do not let your cattle gender with diverse kinds, do not sow mingled seed, and do not wear garments of mixed linen and wool
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:19 prohibits mixing different kinds in animals, seed, and clothing, teaching separation and holiness in daily life (verses 19, 28).

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 19.

questions.question: In Leviticus 19, God commands the Israelites to be holy because He is holy. Which New Testament verse echoes this call to holiness?
questions.correctAnswer: 1 Peter 1:16
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:2 commands holiness because God is holy. 1 Peter 1:16 directly quotes this command, emphasizing a continuous biblical theme.

questions.question: Leviticus 19:9-10 instructs leaving the corners of the field and gleanings for the poor and stranger. This law primarily reflects which cultural concern in the ancient Near East?
options: Social justice and care for the marginalized
questions.correctAnswer: Social justice and care for the marginalized
questions.explanation: Verses 9-10 reveal concern for the poor and foreigners, emphasizing justice and mercy in the social order of Israel.

questions.question: The prohibition against mixing different kinds in Leviticus 19:19 (cattle, seed, garments) is an example of what kind of biblical theme?
questions.correctAnswer: Separation and purity
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:19 commands avoiding mixtures, reflecting the theme of maintaining distinctiveness and holiness in Israel’s identity.

questions.question: Which type of offering is mentioned in Leviticus 19:5, and what does this foreshadow in later biblical typology?
options: Peace offering; foreshadows reconciliation through Christ
Sin offering; foreshadows atonement for sin
questions.correctAnswer: Peace offering; foreshadows reconciliation through Christ
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:5 mentions peace offerings, which in New Testament typology symbolize reconciliation between God and man, fulfilled in Christ.

questions.question: Leviticus 19:12 forbids swearing falsely by God's name. This command is closely tied to which teaching of Jesus in the Sermon on the Mount?
options: Give to the needy in secret
questions.correctAnswer: Do not swear at all
questions.explanation: Jesus in Matthew 5:34-37 intensifies this command by instructing not to swear at all, highlighting truthfulness and integrity.

questions.question: The instruction in Leviticus 19:18 to 'love thy neighbour as thyself' is later cited by which two New Testament figures as central to the law and prophets?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus and Paul
questions.explanation: Jesus (Matthew 22:39) and Paul (Romans 13:9) both affirm this command as foundational to ethical living.

questions.question: The command in Leviticus 19:14 not to curse the deaf or put a stumbling block before the blind is an example of what biblical ethical principle?
questions.correctAnswer: Protecting the vulnerable
questions.explanation: Verse 14 shows concern for those who might be easily harmed, emphasizing justice and compassion.

questions.question: Leviticus 19:27 commands not to 'round the corners of your heads' or 'mar the corners of your beard.' This likely reflects opposition to what ancient Near Eastern practice?
questions.correctAnswer: Idolatrous mourning rituals
questions.explanation: Cutting hair and beard corners was common in pagan mourning rites; Israel was to avoid such customs to maintain distinctiveness.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 19:26 forbids eating anything with the blood and prohibits the use of enchantments and observing times.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 26 clearly forbids consuming blood and engaging in enchantments or observance of times, reflecting purity and idolatry concerns.

questions.question: Leviticus 19:23-25 establishes a waiting period before eating fruit from newly planted trees. This practice symbolizes what broader biblical theme?
options: Patience and consecration of the land
Sacrifice of first fruits to idols
questions.correctAnswer: Patience and consecration of the land
questions.explanation: The three-year waiting period shows respect for the land’s sanctity and God's provision, linking to themes of holiness and dedication.

questions.question: The repeated phrase 'I am the LORD your God' found throughout Leviticus 19 serves primarily to emphasize what aspect of the text?
questions.correctAnswer: Divine authority and covenant relationship
questions.explanation: This phrase asserts God's sovereign authority and reminds Israel of their covenant obligation to obey His statutes.

questions.question: Leviticus 19:15 forbids showing partiality in judgment. How does this principle relate to later biblical justice concepts?
options: It anticipates prophetic calls for impartial justice
It permits favoritism toward the wealthy
It allows judges to be bribed
questions.correctAnswer: It anticipates prophetic calls for impartial justice
questions.explanation: Verse 15 promotes fair judgment, a theme echoed by prophets like Amos and Micah who call for justice without partiality.

questions.question: Which literary device is prominently used in Leviticus 19:18 with the phrase 'love thy neighbour as thyself'?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: The phrase balances 'thy neighbour' and 'thyself,' demonstrating synonymous parallelism common in Hebrew poetry.

questions.question: The command in Leviticus 19:16 not to be a talebearer and not to stand against the blood of thy neighbour reflects which social value?
questions.correctAnswer: Community integrity and responsibility
questions.explanation: This verse forbids gossip and neglecting a neighbor’s well-being, promoting social cohesion and accountability.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19:30, what two things must the Israelites keep and reverence?
questions.correctAnswer: Sabbaths and the sanctuary
questions.explanation: Verse 30 commands reverence for both the Sabbath and the sanctuary, highlighting worship and holiness.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 19 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 19 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is the fundamental reason given in Leviticus 19 for the Israelites to be holy?
options: Because they are chosen by the LORD
Because they must obey the law
Because they are descendants of Abraham
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD is holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:2 commands holiness with the reason 'for I the LORD your God am holy.' This foundational theological truth is echoed in 1 Peter 1:16, Leviticus 11:44, Hebrews 12:14, and Matthew 5:48, emphasizing that God's holiness is the standard for His people.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19, what attitude should one have towards parents?
options: Fear every man his mother and his father
questions.correctAnswer: Fear every man his mother and his father
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:3 commands to 'fear every man his mother, and his father,' indicating reverence and respect. This is consistent with Exodus 20:12, Ephesians 6:2, Proverbs 1:8, and Colossians 3:20, which uphold honoring parents as integral to God's covenant community.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 19 say about offering peace offerings and how they must be handled?
options: They must be eaten the same day or the next day, but not after the third day
They must be offered only by priests
questions.correctAnswer: They must be eaten the same day or the next day, but not after the third day
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:5-7 details that peace offerings are to be eaten on the day of offering or the next, but if eaten on the third day, they are abominable. This reflects God's standard for purity and reverence in worship, as also seen in Exodus 12:10, Numbers 28:9, Hebrews 13:15-16, and 1 Corinthians 11:27.

questions.question: What social responsibility towards the poor and stranger is commanded in Leviticus 19 when harvesting?
options: To reap all corners of the field and gather every grape
To leave the corners of the field and some grapes for the poor and stranger
To sell the gleanings to the highest bidder
To give the harvest only to priests
questions.correctAnswer: To leave the corners of the field and some grapes for the poor and stranger
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:9-10 commands leaving the corners of fields and some grapes unharvested for the poor and stranger. This is consistent with God's justice and mercy, as reflected in Deuteronomy 24:19-21, Ruth 2:2-3, Jeremiah 22:3, and Matthew 25:35.

questions.question: Which of the following actions is explicitly prohibited in Leviticus 19 to maintain righteousness in interpersonal relations?
options: Honoring the rich over the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Stealing and lying
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:11 forbids stealing, dealing falsely, and lying. This aligns with commandments seen in Exodus 20:15, Proverbs 12:22, Ephesians 4:25, and Colossians 3:9, emphasizing truth and integrity in God's covenant community.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 19 instruct concerning the use of God's name in oaths?
options: One must swear by God's name in all oaths
One should not swear falsely by God's name
One may swear by any name
questions.correctAnswer: One should not swear falsely by God's name
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:12 prohibits swearing falsely by God's name or profaning it. This principle is reinforced in Exodus 20:7, Matthew 5:33-37, James 5:12, and Hebrews 6:16, highlighting the holiness and reverence due to God's name.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 19, what is the proper approach to judging others?
options: Respecting the person of the mighty
Honoring the rich and ignoring the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Judging in righteousness without partiality
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:15 instructs to do no unrighteousness in judgment, not to respect the person of the poor or honor the mighty, but to judge neighbor in righteousness. This principle is echoed in Deuteronomy 1:17, Proverbs 24:23, James 2:1-4, and John 7:24.

questions.question: What command does Leviticus 19 give regarding hatred and rebuke among brothers?
options: You must hate your brother in your heart
You must rebuke your neighbor and not bear sin on him
You must avenge and bear grudges
questions.correctAnswer: You must rebuke your neighbor and not bear sin on him
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:17 teaches not to hate brother in heart but to rebuke neighbor and not suffer sin upon him. This reflects God's desire for accountability and love, as also found in Matthew 18:15, Galatians 6:1, Proverbs 27:5, and John 13:34-35.

questions.question: Which command in Leviticus 19 encapsulates the ethical treatment of others and is quoted by Jesus as a summary of the law?
options: You shall love your neighbor as yourself
You shall not eat anything with the blood
questions.correctAnswer: You shall love your neighbor as yourself
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:18 commands loving neighbor as self, a key ethical principle later cited by Jesus in Matthew 22:39, Mark 12:31, Romans 13:9, and Galatians 5:14 as central to fulfilling the law.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 19 forbid regarding mixtures in agriculture and clothing?
options: Mixing only seeds but not fibers
Mixing only fibers but not seeds
questions.correctAnswer: Mixing different seeds or fibers
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:19 forbids gendering cattle of diverse kinds, sowing mingled seed, and wearing garments mingled of linen and wool. This reflects God's order and separation principles, consistent with Deuteronomy 22:9-11, Genesis 1:24-25, and 1 Corinthians 9:24-27.

questions.question: What is the prescribed offering for a man who lies carnally with a bondmaid betrothed to another, according to Leviticus 19?
options: He shall be put to death
He shall bring a ram as a trespass offering
questions.correctAnswer: He shall bring a ram as a trespass offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:20-21 commands that such a man bring a ram for a trespass offering to the LORD, and he shall be scourged but not put to death. This highlights God’s justice balanced with mercy, as reflected in Leviticus 5:15, Numbers 15:25-28, and Hebrews 9:22.

questions.question: What period of fruit from newly planted trees is considered uncircumcised and not to be eaten according to Leviticus 19?
questions.correctAnswer: Three years
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:23 states the fruit from trees is uncircumcised for three years and not to be eaten. This shows God's holiness applied to creation and offering, paralleling Numbers 19:11, Deuteronomy 20:19, and Jeremiah 2:21.

questions.question: What practices does Leviticus 19 forbid that involve defilement through contact with the dead or spiritual mediums?
options: Making cuttings in the flesh and seeking familiar spirits
questions.correctAnswer: Making cuttings in the flesh and seeking familiar spirits
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:28 and 31 forbid making cuttings in flesh for the dead and seeking familiar spirits or wizards, showing God’s call to holiness and separation from pagan practices. Similar teachings are found in Deuteronomy 18:10-12, 1 Chronicles 10:13-14, Isaiah 8:19, and Galatians 5:19-21.

questions.question: How are strangers or sojourners to be treated by the Israelites according to Leviticus 19?
options: They shall be oppressed and vexed
They shall be loved as themselves
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be loved as themselves
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:33-34 commands not to vex strangers but to love them as oneself because Israelites were strangers in Egypt. This reflects God's heart for the foreigner as seen in Exodus 22:21, Deuteronomy 10:19, Matthew 25:35, and Hebrews 13:2.

questions.question: What standards does Leviticus 19 set for weights and measures?
options: To use just balances and weights
To use whatever scales are available
To favor the rich with dishonest weights
questions.correctAnswer: To use just balances and weights
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:35-36 requires just balances, weights, ephah, and hin, emphasizing fairness and justice. This theme is consistent with Proverbs 16:11, Deuteronomy 25:13-16, Isaiah 1:17, and Luke 6:38.

questions.question: What overall exhortation does Leviticus 19 give to the Israelites about God's statutes and judgments?
options: To observe only the statutes they like
To observe all statutes and judgments faithfully
To follow the statutes of neighboring nations
questions.correctAnswer: To observe all statutes and judgments faithfully
questions.explanation: Leviticus 19:37 commands observing all statutes and judgments, affirming obedience as the proper response to God's holiness. This is foundational in Deuteronomy 6:17, Joshua 1:7, Psalm 119:1, and James 1:22.
